title: Refactored ReadMe
body:

1) Removes the `Getting Started` section, as it's redundant with the `Learn More` Section.

title: Replace usage of deprecated pandas.Int64Index()
body:
`pandas.Int64Index()` has been deprecated in favor of using `pandas.Index(dtype='int64')` and the deprecation warnings are clogging testing output. This resolves that issue and should reduce test log noise.

title: Port SdkHarness log options to Dataflow legacy runner
body:
DataflowWorkerLoggingOptions has long been deprecated. Its documentation suggest set options in SdkHarnessOptions for "forward compatibility":

https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/e59f001fdb3d5104cf7f82cdbe0b099e32c7b9c1/runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/dataflow/options/DataflowWorkerLoggingOptions.java#L33

However, SdkHarnessOptions is still not effective on legacy runner. and users need to set both SdkHarnessOptions and DataflowWorkerLoggingOptions if they currently run on legacy runner and plan migration to runner v2.

This PR port defaultSdkHarnessLogLevel and sdkHarnessLogLevelOverrides SdkHarnessOptions to make them effective for Dataflow legacy runner, so user on Dataflow legacy runner only needs to set SdkHarnessOptions, and when DataflowWorkerLoggingOptions is removed in the future (when legacy runner finally tears down), users won't get affected.

title: [BQ Python StorageWriteAPI] Enable writing rows with missing nullable fields
body:
Fixes #28008

Original case was that a user was not able to write to a table with a default column because StorageAPI Write SchemaTransform was performing a strict schema check. This PR removes that check because it's not deemed necessary as rows with mismatch schema will show up in the DLQ.

The user tried a workaround of including the default column in the input schema, but that didn't work because when we convert dict to Beam Rows (to ultimately use Java's Storage Write API), we attach the schema to the collection here: https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/369265db4cd2aa294e6c4c4a4cfc1c8a9e4614c3/sdks/python/apache_beam/io/gcp/bigquery.py#L2237-L2240

This makes Beam throw an error when any Row doesn't match the schema. So even if the default column was in the schema, it wasn't enough because it expected that column to also exist in the Beam Rows. In this PR is a fix to populate any missing nullable fields with `None`. While experimenting, I saw that this is the behavior for `FILE_LOADS` too.

title: Use Periodic Impulse for BQ SchemaUpdate tests
body:
Fixes #27911
Follow-up for #27740

Switch to using PeriodicImpulse instead of TestStream, which is only available on Direct and Flink runners.

Had to make an addition to PeriodicImpulse to make it more streaming friendly. The default behavior is that PeriodicImpulse emits all instants from start until Instant.now(). After that, it starts firing at the specified interval. The changes here add an option to make it fire at the specified interval for all elements. This was needed to test schema update because in this test case we care very much about maintaining a consistent interval period between stream appends. 

Other changes include manually enabling streaming engine. The storage API sink uses GroupIntoBatches, which requires streaming engine. This streaming mode is automatically enabled in Runner V2 but not V1. 

Also followed @Abacn's suggestion of only running the important tests on TestDataflowRunner so that we don't eat too many resources unnecessarily.

title: Don't fail to acquire multi_process_shared object if some attributes aren't available on a given platform
body:
Right now, when using multi_process_shared.py if any public member of an object throws an exception when `getattr` is called on it, the whole object cannot be loaded and an exception is thrown. Some objects, however, will return an exception if a certain attribute is not available on a given platform (even if it is not central to that object functioning). This PR fixes that problem and just logs when encountering cases like that.

title: Always proxy RunInference with large models
body:
This change does 3 things:

1) Uses `always_proxy=True` when using `RunInference` with large models. This guarantees that the model which is being shared across processes has a dedicated process to run in. This means that if a worker goes down, it doesn't have a chance of taking the shared model down with it if it was the one hosting it. This caused the hugging face and pytorch integration tests to fail because pytorch doesn't automatically gracefully handle sharing a model across processes.
2) Updates the hugging face and pytorch model handlers to set `requires_grad(False)` after loading the models. [Gradients](https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/generated/torch.Tensor.requires_grad.html) should already never need to be computed for Pytorch in inference mode and we correctly handle this when operating in a single process already with `torch.no_grad` ([example](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/16e7af2ea4148c65e3e1045e6c05f0d40f498db2/sdks/python/apache_beam/ml/inference/huggingface_inference.py#L175)), but when we proxy to the model in a separate process, that `no_grad` is not respected. This change fixes that and allows our tests to pass.
3) Updates the TMPDIR env var in some of our tests to be a shorter path because multiprocessing relies on it being less than 80 chars long and pytest does not do that on Jenkins by default (it does locally, we just have a very long base directory name in our Jenkins tests).

Example failing postcommit run before applying (2) - https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Python39_PR/160/consoleFull

------------------------

title: Support DatabaseID in Datastore beam connector
body:
[Feature] Support DatabaseID in Datastore beam connector

- This allows users to explicit set DatabaseID in datastore beam connector for read and write. 
- Updated existing beam connector to explicitly set projectID and databaseID.
- The Read option will access DatabaseID via option class defined in DatastoreV1.
- The Write option will access DatabaseID via FirestoreOptions.

title: Increase consistency for BQ typed read with avro source
body:
Fix https://github.com/apache/beam/issues/26329

- Add extra `AvroT`  type parameter in `AvroSource` to memorize the materialized avro record type (the one produced by the avro reading).
- Add possibility to combine both `AvroDatumReader` and `parseFn` in the source.
- Add back `parseFn` to `BigqueryIO.TypedRead` so it behaves as the `AvroSource`.
- Require coder in the API when reading custom types.

title: Fix setup action checkout
body:
Right now, checkout fails if no merge commit has been created (e.g. there's a merge conflict). This fixes the problem by falling back to the branch contents.

Example with merge conflicts - https://github.com/damccorm/beam/pull/179 (eventually fails because the branch doesn't contain action.yml, but it does successfully checkout) - action run - https://github.com/damccorm/beam/actions/runs/5821884233/job/15785245339?pr=179

Example without merge conflicts - https://github.com/damccorm/beam/pull/180 - action run - https://github.com/damccorm/beam/actions/runs/5821902336/job/15785306991?pr=180

title: Bump com.avast.gradle:gradle-docker-compose-plugin from 0.16.12 to 0.17.4
body:
Bumps [com.avast.gradle:gradle-docker-compose-plugin](https://github.com/avast/gradle-docker-compose-plugin) from 0.16.12 to 0.17.4.
Release notes

Sourced from com.avast.gradle:gradle-docker-compose-plugin's releases.

0.17.4

Ensure the -f parameters go right after docker compose.

0.17.3

Revert of a change introduced in 0.17.0 that introduced stderr reading when executing docker command. It leads to an unexpected output if Docker is not fully correctly installed and prints warnings to stderr (while stdout is valid).

0.17.2

Safer JSON parsing of docker compose ps output.

0.17.1

Update to Gradle v8.

0.17.0

  • Migrated to the latest Gradle 7.x
  • As Docker Compose V1 is deprecated, default value of useDockerComposeV2 property was changed from false to true, so docker compose is used by default (instead of docker-compose).
  • More version formats handled in the VersionNumber.parse method.
  • Durations stripped from cache key.

useDockerComposeV2 introduced

No release notes provided.

Commits
  • 101f4ce fix: -f always comes directly after docker compose Fixes #414
  • 1c4d194 fix: stderr of executed docker command ignored again
  • 129275f fix: safer JSON parsing for cache key
  • c01c75c chore: safer closure call for nested settings
  • 8912074 chore: Gradle deprecations warnings handled
  • ae4742c chore: unused import removed
  • ea8f5e1 chore: Gradle updated to v8
  • 178316b conf: useDockerComposeV2 defaults to true (#412)
  • 20b1700 chore: Gradle updated to v7 (#411)
  • 1615aee fix: more version format handled, fixes #407
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: Update how we specify artifact modes

title: Speed up `IntervalWindow` argument construction
body:
In the original snippet, we create two instances of `Timestamp(micros=s)`, the later is rather short
lived as we immediately use the `__add__` dunder
method to create a brand new instance of `Timestamp`.

The change in this commit is to remove the construction of this short lived `Timestamp` and reuse the one already constructed for the `start` argument of `IntervalWindow`.

The speed gain of this change depends on the specification of the `SlidingWindows`. I have a pipeline that is relatively simple and with GCP's profiler in Dataflow, it revealed about ~2.5% of wall time is wasted in constructing this short lived `Timestamp`.

Given that `__add__` doesn't alter the `Timestamp` object inplace (and unlikely to be changed to that behaviour), I think this is a safe change.

------------------------
